body:
Comment 5 by **kenliz@cruzio.com**: 
I followed the instructions at http://golang.org/doc/contribute.html
for submitting code. But it turns out that the mail messages generated by hg mail to
golang-dev get 
blocked. Worse, my ISP filtered out the "Delivery Status Notification (Failure)"
messages as spam, so I would 
not have known, except I happened to review my weekly summary of spam, and noticed them.

Should I open another Issue about this?

Here is the relevant content of one of the bounced messages:

Hello xxxxxx (removed e-mail addess, Ken)

We're writing to let you know that the group you tried to contact (golang-dev) may not
exist, or you may 
not have permission to post messages to the group. A few more details on why you weren't
able to post:

* You might have spelled or formatted the group name incorrectly.
* The owner of the group may have removed this group.
* You may need to join the group before receiving permission to post.
* This group may not be open to posting.

If you have questions related to this or any other Google group, visit the Help Center
at 
http://groups.google.com/support/?hl=en.

Thanks,

google groups
